channel.title: Cultural Credits Events
channel.description: Stetson University's Cultural Credits Calendar of Events

item.title: *60 Years of Russia at Stetson*
item.description: Come celebrate 60 years of Russia at Stetson! Ongoing exhibit until May 2, 2018. Where: SPREES Center (249 E. Michigan Ave - DeLand) When: March 16 - May 2 from 9 am to 3 pm (CLOSED Saturdays/Sundays and Friday, March 30) Contact: Mayhill Fowler (mfowler@stetson.edu) Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *Citizen + Science: Pollinator Project at Gillespie Museum*
*Senior Exhibition I (Studio Art)*
item.description: 2018 Creative Arts Senior Art Exhibition I, featuring work by graduating seniors in Studio Art.

item.title: *CCE Kilometer Kids presents: Kicking It with K-Kids Event*
item.description: Kids from the Boys and Girld Club and Chisholm Community Center will be competing in a huge obstacle course and challenges. Where: Rinker Field When: April 6, 2018 from 3 pm to 5 pm Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *Islam Awareness Week: Mosque Dinner* off campus event at the Islamic Center of Daytona Beach
item.description: Stetson University's Muslim Student Association will be partnering with The Islamic Center of Daytona Beach for their monthly mosque dinner. We will provide attendees with a unique cultural experience by showing the Islam faith from a different perspective through the people, food, and other activities. Since this event is off-campus, those who wish to attend must sign up via MSA's HatterSync page and will be sent a travel wavier they must fill out and turn in to us prior to attending the event. For any questions, please contact Fatima Asad at fasad@stetson.edu. Where: Islamic Center of Daytona Beach When: April 6, 2018 from 6:30 pm to 8 pm Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *The Greater Central Florida Tech Faire + Hackathon 2018*
*Senior Exhibition I (Studio Art)*
item.description: 2018 Creative Arts Senior Art Exhibition I, featuring work by graduating seniors in Studio Art.

item.title: *Screening of "Indivisible" - Documentary on Dreamers*
item.description: “Indivisible” is a documentary about Dreamers and their struggle to gain rights. Following the film, will be a panel discussion involving one of the individuals featured - Evelyn Rivera. This event is part of the Global Citizenship Symposium. Where: duPont-Ball Library room 25L When: April 7, 2018 from 2 pm to 4 pm Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *The Greater Central Florida Tech Faire + Hackathon 2018*
*Hackathon Expo* in the Rinker Field House
item.description: Students from all over Florida will present what they built at the 2018 Hackathon. Where: Rinker Field House When: April 8, 2018 from 12:30 pm to 1:30 pm Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *60 Years of Russia at Stetson*
item.description: Come celebrate 60 years of Russia at Stetson! Ongoing exhibit until May 2, 2018. Where: SPREES Center (249 E. Michigan Ave - DeLand) When: March 16 - May 2 from 9 am to 3 pm (CLOSED Saturdays/Sundays and Friday, March 30) Contact: Mayhill Fowler (mfowler@stetson.edu) Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *Citizen + Science: Pollinator Project at Gillespie Museum*
*Global Symposium Art Exhibit*
item.description: Exhibit of Art and Creative Writing by members of the Stetson campus about immigration: experience, identity, and belonging. Where: duPont-Ball Library When: April 9, 2018 at 5 pm and 7 pm AND April 10, 2018 at 10 am and 11 am Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *ACIREMA*
item.description: Simulation of the series of events/formal processes that international students go through while studying abroad. Where: Emily Hall When: April 9, 2018 from 5 pm to 6:30 pm Cultural Credit Approved This event is NOT open to the public
